result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy J. Leazott

9:39 AM cases 21CF1356, 21CM943, 22CF282 called. Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Randy J. Leazott in court, in custody with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order to Withdraw as Counsel
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel by Attorney Erika Amundson

10:19am Cases called: 21CF1356, 21CM943 & 22CF282. Defendant Randy J. Leazott in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Randy J. Leazott.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant did not qualify for the Public Defender representation so a Court Appointed Attorney was appointed. Defendant now qualifies for Public Defender. Defendant needs time to work out who will be representing him.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Erika Amundson at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 08/12/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

Conditions: 
No contact with A.C. 
Not to use/possess anyone else's personal identifying documents/information.

Defendant no longer qualifies for SPD representation. To apply for county appointed attorney to have Attorney Peterson appointed. 
In 22CF282: Defendant waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Both files: Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7-27-22 at 2:30 PM. 
Hearing scheduled for 8/31/22 at 9:30 AM.
